summary: The Common Sense Air Regulations Act (H.R. 2288) aims to nullify the Environmental Protection Agency's final rule concerning the National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Particulate Matter. Introduced in the House of Representatives on March 24, 2025, the bill targets the EPA's rule published in the Federal Register on March 6, 2024, stating it should have no legal effect. The bill is sponsored by Mr. Carter of Georgia and others, and was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
